question: A coin is dipped in the molten wax in a glass tube. When we heat the upper part of the glass tube, the wax around the coil will not melt because:
option_1: Wax has a very high melting point
option_2: Wax is a good conductor of heat
option_3: Glass is a good conductor of heat
option_4: Wax or glass are bad conductors
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: Wax has a very high melting point

question:
A thermometer has a low thermal
capacity. Why is this an advantage?
